intro: Eriocaulon fuscum, commonly known as the black spike sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense spikelets, typically found in moist habitats such as wetlands and marshes. Eriocaulon fuscum is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid, nutrient-rich environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and semi-aquatic ecosystems.
